txt.en: Dudsig and his guards are blocking the way to Ordlac and the children. Defeat them and confront Ordlac.
Instance: The Broadacres Betrayed
Thane Torferth stands on the road to Stoke.\n\nYou should speak with Thane Torferth before the attack.
'Out of the way, Dudsig! I will not let your master murder those children!'
'Then die with him, traitor!'
Thane Torferth of Torsbury has brought his men to Stoke, where he prepares to march upon the Mead Hall and confront the traitor Ordlac.
'Ordlac! Stop this madness!'
'Torferth! I suppose I will have to deal with you first!'
TBD
Talk to Thane Torferth
Ordlac is near the end of the Mead Hall, threatening Reeve Fr√≠thild's children.\n\nAid Torferth against Ordlac and protect the children.
Arrived at the Mead Hall of Stoke
'Look! Ordlac is threatening the Reeve's children! We must hurry!'
Thane Torferth is in the Mead Hall of Stoke.\n\nYou should speak with Thane Torferth at once.
Defeat Ordlac and protect the children
Talk to Thane Torferth
'I will wish to speak with you later...come see me when you have rested a little.'
'This way... follow me!'
Defeated Dudsig and his guards
Talk to Thane Torferth
'This way! There is no time to lose!'
<rgb=#FF0000>Torferth must not be defeated</rgb>
<rgb=#FF0000>Torferth was defeated</rgb>
Defeated Ordlac
Fight through Ordlac's forces to the Mead Hall of Stoke
<rgb=FF0000>Torferth was defeated</rgb>
Defeat Dudsig and his guards
'What murder? It is not murder to throw down usurpers!'
'The White Hand has promised us Rohan, and Ordlac will bring us that victory!'
The Mead Hall of Stoke is at the end of the road.\n\nTorferth is making for the Mead Hall of Stoke, where he intends to confront Ordlac.

'We are victorious, [placeholder]. Those of Ordlac's men who followed orders without true knowledge of their master's treachery have turned on their brethren and helped rout Oserley from Stoke.\n\n'The battle is over....'

'We have come to it at last, [placeholder], and it is a sad day. Brother must fight brother, and much blood shall be shed. Nevertheless, Ordlac cannot be permitted to continue his treachery.

'Are you ready to march with us? I am sure that Ordlac has reinforced the road to the Mead Hall, but we cannot be delayed!

'Forth the Toringas!'
